HDG.BC.content: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences
HDG.BC.linkedContent: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences

HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.BT.content: Dasein in relation to its past: ‘historizes’ out of its future on each occasion
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Dasein in relation to its past: ‘historizes’ out of its future on each occasion

HDG.BT.content: destruction not negative (purpose not to bury past in nullity (Nichtigkeit), stakes out positive possibilities of that tradition, must keep it w/in its limits [?] > destruction only re: stages of history of ontology that are in principle decisive [epochal thought]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: destruction not negative (purpose not to bury past in nullity (Nichtigkeit), stakes out positive possibilities of that tradition, must keep it w/in its limits [?] > destruction only re: stages of history of ontology that are in principle decisive [epochal thought]

HDG.QB.content: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation
HDG.QB.linkedContent: to connect “work” & “pain”: think fundamental trait of Hegel’s metaphysics: “absolute negativity” as “infinite force” of actuality, i.e., of the “existing concept” > work & pain manifest their innermost metaphysical relatedness in same (not identical) belonging to negation of negation

HDG.QB.content: recollective thinking (Andenken) has task of attending to this concealment, in which unconcealment is grounded [how do you know that, if its essence has not yet been revealed?] > recollect not what becomes past: but all enduring (allem Währen) that each case (je) of Ereignis of X Being grants (gewährt)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: recollective thinking (Andenken) has task of attending to this concealment, in which unconcealment is grounded [how do you know that, if its essence has not yet been revealed?] > recollect not what becomes past: but all enduring (allem Währen) that each case (je) of Ereignis of X Being grants (gewährt)

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)

HDG.FS.content: for Kant, power of conjoining withdraws before the Understanding, unity hasn’t disappeared but remains in background > over-interpreting, Reason as faculty of unity, perceiving of Being, withdraws behind Understanding (for Kant): ontological difference is at stake (im Spiel ist) > understanding can’t grasp/determine absolute synthesis
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Kant, power of conjoining withdraws before the Understanding, unity hasn’t disappeared but remains in background > over-interpreting, Reason as faculty of unity, perceiving of Being, withdraws behind Understanding (for Kant): ontological difference is at stake (im Spiel ist) > understanding can’t grasp/determine absolute synthesis

HDG.FS.content: [Kant’s] understanding incapable of understanding how limitations at heart of reason, abolished once referred to absolute, are produced in this “abolishing” relation (“vernichtenden” Bezug): there is “appeasement (Befriedigung)”: fixities disappear, while oppositions appear in their vitality (Lebendigkeit)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [Kant’s] understanding incapable of understanding how limitations at heart of reason, abolished once referred to absolute, are produced in this “abolishing” relation (“vernichtenden” Bezug): there is “appeasement (Befriedigung)”: fixities disappear, while oppositions appear in their vitality (Lebendigkeit)

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, reflection gains standing (Bestehen) in absolute [?], this standing goes unanalyzed in Hegel (limit in his thought?) [does Heidegger analyze standing sufficiently?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, reflection gains standing (Bestehen) in absolute [?], this standing goes unanalyzed in Hegel (limit in his thought?) [does Heidegger analyze standing sufficiently?]

HDG.FS.content: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.content: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [indifference point?] unity of opposites as non-dichotomous, more precise than in-finite, a “positing” that is neither simple opposition or simple unity: unity that contains in itself all oppositions > Absolute is “most non-dichotomous identity”

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, all moments (reflection, construction, production, contraction) when grasping of Absolute by Reason are accomplished takes place in “consciousness”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, all moments (reflection, construction, production, contraction) when grasping of Absolute by Reason are accomplished takes place in “consciousness”

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.FS.content: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)

HDG.FS.content: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, production of Absolute: Gestalt of reflection’s accomplishment (Vollzugs) > Absolute brought forth before consciousness, i.e. pro-duced, not making but “letting appear (erscheinen Lassen)” > this pro-duction is a construction (architectonic) that means: Zusammengehöriges im Sich-zeigen des Absoluten als zusammengehörig zusammenbauen (zusammenstellen) [belonging together in self-showing (of Absolute) as belonging together that builds together (a setting together)]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, production of Absolute: Gestalt of reflection’s accomplishment (Vollzugs) > Absolute brought forth before consciousness, i.e. pro-duced, not making but “letting appear (erscheinen Lassen)” > this pro-duction is a construction (architectonic) that means: Zusammengehöriges im Sich-zeigen des Absoluten als zusammengehörig zusammenbauen (zusammenstellen) [belonging together in self-showing (of Absolute) as belonging together that builds together (a setting together)]

HDG.FS.content: final moment of Absolute in Hegel, contraction, cum-trahere, drawing-together (zusammen-ziehen) of all opposites to highest unity of Absolute [condensation?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: final moment of Absolute in Hegel, contraction, cum-trahere, drawing-together (zusammen-ziehen) of all opposites to highest unity of Absolute [condensation?]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel’s “non-conscious (das Bewusstlose)” evokes Freud, but difference is extreme: Freud’s unconscious (das Unbewusste) doesn’t belong “in consciousness,” whereas for Hegel, difference btwn conscious/non-conscious belongs to consciousness, constructed in consciousness as the Absolute (which is both) > for Hegel [?], non-conscious means not yet posited/sublated
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel’s “non-conscious (das Bewusstlose)” evokes Freud, but difference is extreme: Freud’s unconscious (das Unbewusste) doesn’t belong “in consciousness,” whereas for Hegel, difference btwn conscious/non-conscious belongs to consciousness, constructed in consciousness as the Absolute (which is both) > for Hegel [?], non-conscious means not yet posited/sublated

HDG.FS.content: Fichte absolutized Cartesian cogito, leads to ABSOLUTE KNOWLEDGE, place of absolute certainty, in which absolute knowledge knows itself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Fichte absolutized Cartesian cogito, leads to ABSOLUTE KNOWLEDGE, place of absolute certainty, in which absolute knowledge knows itself

HDG.CCP.content: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: as release from transcendental re-presentation, Gelassenheit is a relinquishing of the willing of a horizon > this relinquishing doesn’t stem from a willing, except the occasion for releasing oneself to Gegnet “requires a trace of willing” > this trace vanishes while releasing oneself & is completely extinguished in Gelassenheit [annihilation of trace or absolute ash?]

HDG.DL.content: [bypassing nihilism of the passing of Es ist] passing of past as gathering of what endures (Währenden), endures as what grants endurance (Gewährende)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [bypassing nihilism of the passing of Es ist] passing of past as gathering of what endures (Währenden), endures as what grants endurance (Gewährende)

HDG.LP.content: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]

HDG.LP.content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static
HDG.LP.linkedContent: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

HDG.LP.content: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]

HDG.EC.content: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present
HDG.EC.linkedContent: is waiting a safeguarding (Hüten)/tending (Pflegen) if we are waiting upon nothing? > waiting is letting come (Kommenlassen) [in the sense of safeguarding, that which is entrusted (anvertraut) to us] [must the entrusted be present or can it still be held in reserve (noch aufbehalten)?] > what do we let come? > we let come the coming [Derrida, a-venir, to-come] > to think of the coming (an das Kommen denken): an enigmatic commemorating (Andenken) > waiting is future-directed and thus reversed commemorating > but if waiting does not await, neither directed toward future or past, nor something already present

HDG.OHF.content: we can find the way our today regards the past in historical human sciences: they hand over historical past as finished/readily available possession
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: we can find the way our today regards the past in historical human sciences: they hand over historical past as finished/readily available possession

HDG.OHF.content: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [periodization] historical human sciences view life of culture as objectifications of the subjective (don’t further examine character of being): culture is an organism, autonomous organic life > Spengler took this way of seeing the past the furthest [?], had courage to actualize [further than Nietzsche?]

HDG.OHF.content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

HDG.OHF.content: the being-context or validity-context of system either: 1) free-floating, absolutely valid in itself 2) or both what’s thought by Absolute spirit and its thinking (Hegel or Augustinian Neoplatonism)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: the being-context or validity-context of system either: 1) free-floating, absolutely valid in itself 2) or both what’s thought by Absolute spirit and its thinking (Hegel or Augustinian Neoplatonism)

HDG.OHF.content: object of the past (Vergangenheit), in historical consciousness, stands in fundamental definition (Grundbestimmung): Ausdrucksein eines etwas von etwas > the past’s being subjected to a known definition, temporally particular styles > Vor-sicht (fore-sight) [not forehaving?] having the style in view
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: object of the past (Vergangenheit), in historical consciousness, stands in fundamental definition (Grundbestimmung): Ausdrucksein eines etwas von etwas > the past’s being subjected to a known definition, temporally particular styles > Vor-sicht (fore-sight) [not forehaving?] having the style in view

HDG.OHF.content: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “tarrying among (Verweilen bei)” sustains possibility of actualizing a universal classifying that compares [historical] forms, in it lies relational guarantee that every past culture can be encountered objectively > a constant seeing this & that, can never halt [cf. 45 abode-less tarrying (das aufenthaltslose Verweilen) that holds itself/sojourns in (Aufhalten) what it returns to) > what’s encountered in this Verweilen as universal possibility of expression, divided into unities of style: beings in the How of their having-being, already there [for us to see] (i.e. past is available, is a past present, not our virtuality) > a pull (Zug) arises from the already there (schon da) in the past: world, life, publicness, what was going on [if destruction occurs by thinking Zug outside of Zug of historical consciousness, deconstruction occurs by noting that Zug of historical consciousness never occurs, i.e that everyday facticity has been overdetermined, we were never that close to it]

HDG.OHF.content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
